newsitem.title: ITALY: Reno de Medici,Saffa study merger.
newsitem.headline: Reno de Medici,Saffa study merger.

text.p: Shares in Italian companies Reno de Medici and Saffa were suspended on Monday on the Milan bourse as the two groups said in a statement that they were studying a merger.
A statement from the board of cardboard and packaging group Reno de Medici said it had authorised its chairman to put forward a study of the merger between the two cardboard manufacturing companies.
Reno de Medici was only listed on the Milan bourse in July 1996 and reported 1996 consolidated net profits of 11.7 billion lire up from 7.1 billion lire in 1995.
